articles.headline: AT&T and Verizon Delay 5G Service Near Some Airports
articles.snippet: Whether the change would end the long conflict between the telecom and aviation industries wasn’t clear.
articles.abstract: Whether the change would end the long conflict between the telecom and aviation industries wasn’t clear.
articles.lead_paragraph: Verizon and AT&T said on Tuesday that they would delay the expansion of new 5G cellular service near some airports, a pause that President Biden said would avert potentially devastating disruptions that airlines had been warning about for months.
articles.byline: By Niraj Chokshi and David McCabe

articles.headline: Jan. 6 Panel Subpoenas Giuliani, Digging Into False Vote Fraud Claims
articles.snippet: The House committee investigating the Capitol riot called for documents and testimony from Rudolph W. Giuliani and other members of President Donald J. Trump’s legal team.
articles.abstract: The House committee investigating the Capitol riot called for documents and testimony from Rudolph W. Giuliani and other members of President Donald J. Trump’s legal team.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol on Tuesday subpoenaed Rudolph W. Giuliani and other members of the legal team that pursued a set of conspiracy-filled lawsuits on behalf of former President Donald J. Trump in which they made unsubstantiated claims of fraud in the 2020 presidential election.
articles.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: ‘New Eyes’: Gamers Greet Microsoft’s Activision Deal With Guarded Optimism
articles.snippet: Some players, unhappy with Activision in recent years, said the Microsoft deal could reverse a decline in quality.
articles.abstract: Some players, unhappy with Activision in recent years, said the Microsoft deal could reverse a decline in quality.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Drew Bienusa began playing Call of Duty, a first-person shooter game published by Activision Blizzard, he was immediately smitten. He loved how immersive having a digital avatar was, and the game was a favorite among his friends.
articles.byline: By Erin Woo and Kellen Browning

articles.headline: ‘We Are Taiwanese’: China’s Growing Menace Hardens Island’s Identity
articles.snippet: More than ever, Taiwan defines itself by its democratic values. Beijing’s military and diplomatic threats only reinforce the island’s separateness.
articles.abstract: More than ever, Taiwan defines itself by its democratic values. Beijing’s military and diplomatic threats only reinforce the island’s separateness.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHIAYI, Taiwan — When Li Yuan-hsin, a 36-year-old high school teacher, travels abroad, people often assume she is Chinese.
articles.byline: By Amy Qin and Amy Chang Chien

articles.headline: Everyone Is Quitting. Here’s the Right Way to Do It.
articles.snippet: From understanding why you want to leave to tackling health insurance and retirement plans, here’s your guide to a graceful exit — without leaving money on the table.
articles.abstract: From understanding why you want to leave to tackling health insurance and retirement plans, here’s your guide to a graceful exit — without leaving money on the table.
articles.lead_paragraph: Everyone, sometime or another, dreams of quitting. For millions, the fantasy is real.

articles.headline: ‘It’s All Just Wild’: Tech Start-Ups Reach a New Peak of Froth
articles.snippet: There’s more money and more bubbly behavior. Investors insist it’s rational.
articles.abstract: There’s more money and more bubbly behavior. Investors insist it’s rational.
articles.lead_paragraph: How crazy is the money sloshing around in start-up land right now?

articles.headline: When My Mom Got Covid, I Went Searching for Pfizer’s Pills
articles.snippet: The experience showed how hard it is for many people to get potentially lifesaving treatments.
articles.abstract: The experience showed how hard it is for many people to get potentially lifesaving treatments.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just after 1 p.m. on Tuesday last week, my phone buzzed with a text message from my mother: “Well, came down with cold, aches, cough etc over wknd.” She had taken an at-home coronavirus test. It was positive.
